strings.onboarding-main-intro-text: This short tour will help you learn how to use the app. Follow the steps to get started.
strings.onboarding-main-piano-text:
This is the piano projection area. When connected to a MIDI controller, the keys you play are highlighted here.
Click and drag the piano up or down to change its position on the screen. If you are using Touch control mode, you can still move the keyboard with the middle or right mouse button.
Use the mouse wheel to zoom in or out.
strings.onboarding-main-control-text:
Click the Control button to choose how you want to play the piano. You can use a MIDI keyboard, your mouse or touch screen, or your computer keyboard.
The first time you click this button, your browser will ask for permission to access MIDI devices. After permission is granted and the connection is successful, a green light will turn on.
strings.onboarding-main-sound-text: Click the Sound button to choose a sound for the piano. If you prefer a silent keyboard, or if you already have sound on your controller, you can leave this turned off.
strings.onboarding-main-transpose-text:
Click the Transpose button to transpose by semitones or octaves. You can also use Page Up and Page Down; hold Shift to transpose by octaves.
When transposed, a yellow light will turn on.
strings.onboarding-main-size-text: Click the Size button to change how many keys are shown on the screen or how tall the keys appear.
strings.onboarding-main-appearance-text: Click the Appearance button to change the colors of the keys and other visual details.
strings.onboarding-main-pedals-text:
Click the Pedals button to control how the app reacts to pedal input. The app supports both sustain and sostenuto pedals.
When you press a pedal, the corresponding pedal indicator lights up on the button.
strings.onboarding-main-labels-text:
Click the Labels button (or press F2) to turn on Labeling mode. Then click any key to show or hide its label.
Hold Ctrl while clicking to apply the label to that same note in all octaves.
Use the menu next to the button to choose from several label formats, such as English, German, Italian, solfège, pitch class, MIDI note number, or frequency.
strings.onboarding-main-stickers-text:
Click the Stickers button (or press F3) to turn on Sticker mode. Then click a key to place or remove a colored sticker. Hold Ctrl while clicking to apply a sticker to that same note in all octaves.
Use the menu next to the button to choose the sticker color.
strings.onboarding-main-panic-text: If a key seems stuck or a note keeps sounding, click the Panic button (or press Esc). This will reset the keyboard.
strings.onboarding-main-options-text: Click the More options button to change additional settings, such as language and graphics quality.
strings.onboarding-main-toggle-toolbar-text: You can hide the top toolbar by clicking the small button on its right side or by pressing F9. To show it again, move the mouse to the top-right corner of the screen.
strings.onboarding-main-kbdnav-text: Hold the Alt key to show the keyboard navigation bar. This lets you move through the app's functionality using your computer keyboard.
